google_reviews.review: Really great apartments located in a central area! Very close to fairhaven, downtown bellingham, and i5. There's a trail right behind the apartment, so the views are great when everything is in bloom. PCR is currently the property management company and they are very kind, responsive, and do a great job.

summary.text:
Good

In the realm of satisfying residence experiences, Voltaire Court Apartments boasts a central location that has been positively highlighted in user reviews. The proximity to Fairhaven, downtown Bellingham, and the I-5 makes it a convenient choice for residents looking for ease of accessibility to local amenities. Additionally, the natural beauty of the trail behind the apartment, particularly when in bloom, enhances the living experience by offering picturesque views that residents can enjoy year-round.

Great

Exemplary property management is a standout feature for Voltaire Court Apartments, as reflected by user reviews. PCR, the managing company, receives praise for their kindness, responsiveness, and overall great job in managing the property. It's clear from the feedback that the management's approach to service significantly contributes to the positive living experience at Voltaire Court Apartments, setting a standard for others in the industry.

Bad

Given that there is only a single user review available, there are no recurring complaints or negative themes that emerge to reflect a "bad" aspect of Voltaire Court Apartments. With only positive comments regarding both the property and the management company, this section does not have any specific detail of a negative resident experience to report as of this article's creation.

Ugly

Similar to the "Bad" section, the lack of multiple reviews makes it difficult to form a comprehensive opinion on any "ugly" aspects of Voltaire Court Apartments. The user reviews do not contain references to neglected duties, unreturned security deposits, poor communication, or any severe issues that would warrant inclusion in this section. Therefore, at this time, the article does not feature any "ugly" elements related to the property management company or the apartment itself.
